item.title: Report X-2024060409
item.description:
Report X-2024060409

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: EAGLE PASS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1544
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UTLX 208792 had a slow drip of diesel from the BOV cap. After inspecting found the BOV had a disengaging bottom outlet handle. The handle was disengaged and secured with the BOV not completely closed and securement pin hanging from chain. Outlet cap was found slightly tool tight but able to be easily turned with wrench. Bottom outlet cap was removed, and cap gasket inspected found to be in good condition. No product dripping from the BOV after completely closing the valve BO/cap reinstalled, and tool tightened.

item.title: Report X-2024061022
item.description:
Report X-2024061022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-11
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RESPONDER, THAT THERE WAS A HAZMAT LEAKER ON UNLOAD DOOR NUMBER 6 SLIDE. ACQUIRED LEAKING PACKAGING DECISION TREE AND DON PPE. UPON INSPECTION OF PACKAGE FOUND PACKAGE TO BE A FLAMMABLE LIQUID,3. PACKAGE WAS WET ON BOTTOM AND SIDE OF BOX. RESPONDER ABSORBED AND CLEANED UP SPILLED MATERIAL, PLACED ABSORBED MATERIAL AND DAMAGED HAZMAT PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY, AND TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: Aaron Gutierrez Operations Supervisor called safety to report a spill on the dock at bay door 92. Aaron stated the center 55 gallon drum appears to be leaking and can see a pin hole on the bottom of the drum sitting on the pallet. Aaron stated it is a slow leak and appears to have leaked 15oz on the dock floor. Aaron stated the pallet of 55 gallon drums has been setting on the dock floor and has not been moved is the reason the spill was found today while fixing to load it in a trailer. ~

item.title: Report E-2024060032
item.description:
Report E-2024060032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-02
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 02, 2024 at 1430 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately 7 gallons of WHT03P1 Monomer-Free Polyester Pigment Dispersion. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 7 gallons of WHT03P1 Monomer-Free Polyester Pigment Dispersion (UN1866, 3 III) from (3) 5-gallon plastic pails. The release was caused by the pallet not having any dunnage, and the pails falling during transit. The release was contained to an area on the trailer floor and a 4ft x 4ft area of concrete beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged pails containing material for reprocessing, were placed in (1) 55-gallon DF and the waste was placed in (1) 55-gallon DF and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024050041
item.description:
Report I-2024050041

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: STG Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The release occurred due to the intermodal container tipping on its side while in the STG Logistics yard, due to heavy weight at top of container. As a result, a minimal amount of product released from the seal on the tipped totes. Free product was contained to gravel surface just below the intermodal container. Container was up righted, and Ambipar was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, Ambipar inspected the container and confirmed totes were in tact, a minimal amount of free product had released from the seal, and was contained to container surface and gravel. Ambipar proceeded to use absorbent material to absorb the free product, and surface scraped the impacted gravel from within the lot. Freight was offloaded, container was cleaned, and shipment was reloaded and secured. Two 55-gallon drums of spent absorbent, cleanup debris, and impacted gravel were generated.

item.title: Report E-2024060047
item.description:
Report E-2024060047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CEVA LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 5, 2024, at 1455 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by CEVA Logistics personnel in Dallas, Texas regarding the release of IPA TT-I-735A. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of a total of 1 gallon of IPA TT-I-735A (UN1219, 3, II) from (3) 5-gallon steel pails. The release was caused by a load shift and contained to a 3ft x 3ft area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged pails containing residual material were placed in (1) 95-gallon overpack DF and the impacted absorbents were placed in (1) 55-gallon DF and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060096
item.description:
Report E-2024060096

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: AUSTIN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 3, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3066 was dented in transit and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the impacted trailer and pavement. LSH personnel placed the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum to be transported back on the trailer as damaged product. All impacted debris was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN3267-impacted trailer and pavement. All impacted debris was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
